intro: Pfaffia reticulata f. obtusiuscula, commonly known as the Brazilian ginseng, is a rare and endangered plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Compositae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for its purported health benefits. Its conservation status is critically threatened due to habitat loss and overharvesting. Botanically, it exhibits unique morphological features that distinguish it from other members of its genus.
